title: Spells of showers, fairly strong winds expected in parts of the island today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts today (16), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: ‘No deal’: Trump calls summit with Putin ‘productive,’ but doesn’t announce ceasefire
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin emerged from a nearly three-hour meeting on the Ukraine war and gave public statements, but left without announcing any agreement or ceasefire.

title: Rameswaram fishers fast for release of men, boats in Sri Lanka
byline: Fishermen in Rameswaram observed a hunger strike on Friday demanding the release of their fellow mates and their boats currently held by Sri Lankan authorities.

title: Two arrested with Kerala cannabis worth over Rs. 50 mln
byline: The Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) has arrested two suspects in possession of a large consignment of Kerala cannabis valued at more than Rs. 50 million.

title: Driver dead, 22 injured in head-on collision of buses in Monaragala
byline: A person was killed and at least 22 others were injured when a private bus collided head-on with a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus in Weliyaya, Monaragala, this morning (16).

title: Flash floods kill more than 280 people in India and Pakistan as thousands flee
byline: Flash floods triggered by torrential rains have killed over 280 people in India and Pakistan and left scores of others missing, officials said Friday, as rescuers brought to safety some 1,600 people from two mountainous districts in the neighboring countries.

title: Trump says Russia has lost India as an oil client, secondary tariffs will be devastating
byline: US President Donald Trump said that Russia has lost India as an oil client, while also suggesting that the United States may not immediately impose secondary sanctions on China.

title: Nearly 700 suspects arrested in island-wide special operations
byline: A total of 689 suspects have been arrested during island-wide special operations within yesterday, police said.

title: Postal workers to launch islandwide strike from tomorrow
byline: The Postal and Telecommunications Officers’ Union together with the United Postal Trade Unions Front (UPTUF) has announced that they will commence a strike action from 4.00 p.m. tomorrow (17).

title: Govt committed to establish stable policies to drive gem export growth – PM
byline: Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that, although Sri Lanka has already gained international recognition for gems and jewellery, exports have not grown to the expected level, and the government is working to establish stable policies to enable the country to capture the international gem and jewellery market.

title: USS Santa Barbara arrives in Colombo
byline: United States Navy Ship (USS) Santa Barbara (LCS 32) arrived at the port of Colombo on a replacement purpose today (16).

title: Former PS member remanded for threatening, assaulting officers at Padukka Police
byline: A former member of the Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha who was arrested for allegedly threatening, verbally abusing and assaulting police officers at the Padukka Police Station while protesting the arrest of a motorist involved in a car accident, has been remanded until August 29.

title: 20% of CEB’s engineers have left for overseas employment
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has reported that around 20 percent of its engineers have left the country over the past few years.

title: Zelensky says will meet Trump in Washington on Monday
byline: Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelensky will head to Washington on Monday to discuss “ending the killing and the war” with US President Donald Trump, he announced Saturday.

title: SLMC backs hartal called by ITAK in North and East
byline: The Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) says that it stands in full solidarity with the hartal announced by the Illankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) on Monday (18) as a peaceful protest demanding justice and accountability over the recent death of a 32-year-old in Mullaitivu.

title: Indian naval ships in Colombo for SLINEX-25 naval exercise
byline: Indian Naval Ships INS Rana (a Guided Missile Destroyer) and INS Jyoti (Fleet Tanker) arrived at Colombo to participate in the 12th edition of Sri Lanka India Naval Exercise (SLINEX-25) scheduled from August 14 to 18.

title: Leave of all postal employees cancelled
byline: The leave of all employees of the Department of Posts has been cancelled with effect from tomorrow (17).

title: ‘Galu Kumari’ train derails near Ginthota station
byline: A train has reportedly derailed near the Ginthota railway station, disrupting train services on the Coastal Railway Line.

title: Sri Lanka Customs records highest-ever monthly revenue of Rs. 235 bln
byline: Director General of Customs, Sunil Nonis, announced that Sri Lanka Customs recorded its highest-ever monthly revenue in history last month, with collections amounting to Rs. 235 billion.

title: Pakistan rescuers recover bodies after monsoon rains kill over 340
byline: Rescuers struggled to retrieve bodies from muddy debris on Saturday after flash floods triggered by heavy monsoon rains across northern Pakistan killed at least 344 people in the past 48 hours, authorities said.
